intro: Cordia sebestena var. caymanensis, commonly known as the Cayman cordia, is a shrub or small tree native to the Cayman Islands. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically orange or red in color. It thrives in coastal and limestone habitats, often growing in sandy or well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
